verses.text_plain: So I returned, and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold the tears of such as were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.
verses.verse_html:
1So I returned, and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold the tears of such as were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter. ▼
▼ side: Heb. hand

verses.text_plain: Wherefore I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive.
verses.verse_html: 2Wherefore I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive.

verses.text_plain: Yea, better is he than both they, which hath not yet been, who hath not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.
verses.verse_html: 3Yea, better is he than both they, which hath not yet been, who hath not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.

verses.text_plain: Again, I considered all travail, and every right work, that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.
verses.verse_html:
4Again, I considered all travail, and every right work, that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit. ▼
▼ every…: Heb. all the rightness of work
 , ▼
▼ for this…: Heb. this is the envy of a man from his neighbour

footnotes.body_text: ▼ every…: Heb. all the rightness of work
footnotes.body_html: ▼ every…: Heb. all the rightness of work

footnotes.body_text: ▼ for this…: Heb. this is the envy of a man from his neighbour
footnotes.body_html: ▼ for this…: Heb. this is the envy of a man from his neighbour

verses.text_plain: The fool foldeth his hands together, and eateth his own flesh.
verses.verse_html: 5The fool foldeth his hands together, and eateth his own flesh.

verses.text_plain: Better is an handful with quietness, than both the hands full with travail and vexation of spirit.
verses.verse_html: 6Better is an handful with quietness, than both the hands full with travail and vexation of spirit.

verses.text_plain: Then I returned, and I saw vanity under the sun.
verses.verse_html: 7Then I returned, and I saw vanity under the sun.

verses.text_plain: There is one alone, and there is not a second; yea, he hath neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither saith he, For whom do I labour, and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity, yea, it is a sore travail.
verses.verse_html: 8There is one alone, and there is not a second; yea, he hath neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither saith he, For whom do I labour, and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity, yea, it is a sore travail.

verses.text_plain: Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour.
verses.verse_html: 9Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour.

verses.text_plain: For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth; for he hath not another to help him up.
verses.verse_html: 10For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth; for he hath not another to help him up.

verses.text_plain: Again, if two lie together, then they have heat: but how can one be warm alone?
verses.verse_html: 11Again, if two lie together, then they have heat: but how can one be warm alone?

verses.text_plain: And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.
verses.verse_html: 12And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.

verses.text_plain: Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished.
verses.verse_html:
13Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished. ▼
▼ who…: Heb. who knoweth not to be admonished

footnotes.body_text: ▼ who…: Heb. who knoweth not to be admonished
footnotes.body_html: ▼ who…: Heb. who knoweth not to be admonished

verses.text_plain: For out of prison he cometh to reign; whereas also he that is born in his kingdom becometh poor.
verses.verse_html: 14For out of prison he cometh to reign; whereas also he that is born in his kingdom becometh poor.

verses.text_plain: I considered all the living which walk under the sun, with the second child that shall stand up in his stead.
verses.verse_html: 15I considered all the living which walk under the sun, with the second child that shall stand up in his stead.

verses.text_plain: There is no end of all the people, even of all that have been before them: they also that come after shall not rejoice in him. Surely this also is vanity and vexation of spirit.
verses.verse_html: 16There is no end of all the people, even of all that have been before them: they also that come after shall not rejoice in him. Surely this also is vanity and vexation of spirit.

tokens.text: of all that have been before
them: they also that come after
